column1: What do we call the material that allow light to pass through, making objects clearly visible when viewed throught this material? (transparent/opaque/translucent)
Light always travels in a ____ line (curvy/ oval/ straight)
Reflection happens when light strikes and then ____ a surface. (breaks/ bounces off/ reflects)
What is the bending of light through transparent materials called: (refraction/ reflection/ transparent)
People cast shadow on ground as they walk because they block (view/ way/ light)
Shadow is short when sun is overhead at: (noon/ sunset/ morning)
Frosted (privacy) shower glass is (opaque/ translucent/ transparent)
